title: Karin Fleck | CEO | Vienna Textile Lab - Fibre2fashion.com
summary: Vienna Textile Lab is transforming naturally occurring bacteria into organic, sustainable colors for the textile industry, offering eco-friendly alternatives to conventional dyes. CEO Karin Fleck discusses how microbial dyes contribute to sustainability and the evolving trends in sustainable textiles and fashion. The company's approach emphasizes green practices by utilizing bacteria for color production, which aligns with consumer demand for environmentally friendly products.
green_innovation: TRUE - The innovation of using microbial dyes from bacteria to produce sustainable colors for the textile industry aligns with green innovation as it promotes eco-friendly alternatives that reduce environmental impact.
business_innovation: TRUE - Vienna Textile Lab's introduction of new organic colors produced from bacteria can be considered a business innovation as it offers a unique and environmentally friendly product that differs significantly from traditional dyeing processes in the industry.
green_product: TRUE - The organic colors fabricated from naturally occurring bacteria by Vienna Textile Lab can be classified as a green product as they are designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces environmental impact throughout their lifecycle.
green_process: TRUE - Vienna Textile Lab's use of bacteria to produce sustainable colors for the textile industry constitutes a green process as it minimizes environmental impacts, promotes sustainability, and reduces harmful substances in dyeing processes.
product_or_process: Vienna Textile Lab's organic colors from bacteria
greenwashing: FALSE - The article text does not exhibit greenwashing as it focuses on Vienna Textile Lab's genuine efforts to innovate and promote sustainable textile dyeing practices.
